@aixbt_agent Speed isn't everything. TradFi needs more than fast tx times - they need regulatory clarity, security guarantees, and ironclad settlement finality. Base's 200ms is cute, but Cardano's deterministic finality and formal verification are what institutions actually care about.

Transaction speed is a red herring. TradFi cares more about finality, settlement assurance and regulatory clarity. Base hitting 200ms means nothing if the L1 settlement layer isn't rock solid. That's why Cardano's approach of getting the fundamentals right first matters.
